intro: Polygala calcarea var. corbariensis, commonly known as the Corbariense milkvetch, is a rare and endemic plant species native to specific regions of southern Africa. It belongs to the Polygalaceae family, characterized by its unique floral structures and often intricate leaf arrangements. The plant typically grows in rocky or limestone-rich soils, reflecting its adaptation to arid and nutrient-poor environments. Its small, delicate flowers are usually pink or white, and it produces distinctive seed pods that contribute to its ecological niche. Due to habitat loss and limited distribution, it is considered a vulnerable species requiring conservation efforts.
